translation: And now, O Arjuna, hear from Me of the threefold pleasure, in which one rejoices through practice and surely comes to the end of pain.
commentary: 18.36 pleasure pleasure? You indeed? Idanim now? threefold threefold? hear hear? Me of Me? Bharatarshabha O lord of the Bharatas? from practice from practice? Enjoying rejoices? where in which? Dukhantam the end of pain? f and? Nigachchati (he) attains to.Commentary A little of this pleasure experienced by the Self must result in the cessation of pain. This pleasure is threefold in its nature and I will describe its aspects in turn? O Arjuna. (Cf.VI.20?30).
